channel.title: RROD Question
channel.description:
I was playing MW2 and then my screen blinked and i looked at my console and i had the 3 red rings but blinking very fast, i restarted it and it started up fine with no rings like it normally would. At about 10am this happened and its 6pm, ive been playing all day. I figured it was my console getting to hot so i moved it farther from my wall and put a fan behind it to blow fresh air near the vents.
My question is can the power blinking quickly cause some sort of rrod? The power blinked about 3 times within 20 minutes while i was playing so just to be safe i plugged it into a surge protector.
I also looked it up and it seems that many people are getting RROD from MW2, some people are getting it within the first 5 minutes.

item.title: RROD Question
item.dc:creator: @cumescape cumescape
item.description:
@cumescape wrote:

[quote=“ownagesbot, post:15, topic:313782”][quote author=Frell link=topic=410288.msg3029202#msg3029202 date=1258238959]

It happens, most likely an overheat or something similar. Although bare in mind if your xbox is overheating its likely to be melting the joints around the CPU/GPU which is the cause of a full scale 3RROD.

I put a small fan behind it to blow on the back vent so it has some fresh air. It doesnt feel that hot.
[/quote]I ran mine open cased for about a year, the xbox as a whole lasted me from about 4months after launch to about 6weeks ago. I never thought it was running hot, on further inspection I could see imprints of the CPU chip on the heatsink. I then tried to fix it with the heatgun trick and what I believe to be a transistor (although I don’t know of any transistors that have liquid in them, although again could have melted), started smoking and spitting out red hot acid looking stuff. After that it wouldn’t even turn on so ye. I kind know from experience. Anyway, they do it on occasion, you should be fine.[/quote]

Shit is hot.

Read full topic

item.title: RROD Question
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:14, topic:313782”][quote author=ownagesbot link=topic=410288.msg3029197#msg3029197 date=1258238692]
It happens, most likely an overheat or something similar. Although bare in mind if your xbox is overheating its likely to be melting the joints around the CPU/GPU which is the cause of a full scale 3RROD.
[/quote]
I put a small fan behind it to blow on the back vent so it has some fresh air. It doesnt feel that hot.[/quote]

You do know that the fans on the rear of the xbox aren’t intake fans. So by blowing air into the fans, you pretty much killed your xbox. That’s why those shitty intercooler fans got recalled.

Read full topic

item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

Frell, get some Arctic Silver and apply a decent amount on both the GPU and CPU and remember to scrape the old shit off as well

Read full topic

item.title: RROD Question
item.dc:creator: @mr_arrows95 bansil
item.description:
@mr_arrows95 wrote:

Dont play it as long
i play about 8-10 hours a day with a intercooler (12$) at game stop but if i dont have a intercooler i play about 5 hours because when it gets overheated your Laser On the disc tray will burn out and youl have to pay 100 to get it repaired.
